sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1: Let A = {1,2} and B = {2,3}. Find (A (Δ) B) × {1} and A × (B (Δ) {1}) where (Δ) represents symmetric difference. Show that the results are not equal, proving that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
